title: Nehemiah’s Final Reforms
summary: After a return trip to Persia, Nehemiah finds that spiritual compromise has crept in. He throws out Tobiah from the temple, restores Sabbath observance, and corrects intermarriage with foreign women, zealously defending God’s covenant.

faq.question: What problems did Nehemiah confront upon returning?
faq.answer: Foreigners living in the temple, neglect of Levites, Sabbath violations, and intermarriage.

faq.question: How did Nehemiah respond?
faq.answer: With righteous anger, strong corrective actions, and renewed covenant enforcement.
